name: Taraxacum
description: Taraxacum, widely known as Dandelion, is a large genus of more than 500 species of herbaceous perennials in the Asteraceae family, native to Eurasia.Dandelions are immensely popular and spread all over the world, growing anywhere there is a pinch of soil. They come in various shapes and sizes, with their yellow flowers blooming all season long. These invasive weeds can occupy a variety of environments, giving them an impressive look and magical appearance!
meaning: The genus name Taraxacum comes from the Greek words “taraxos”, which means “disorder” and “akos”, meaning “remedy”. The common name Dandelion is a corruption of the French “dent de lion”, which means “lion’s tooth”, referring to the plant’s jagged leaves.
color_description: The flowers are usually bright yellow, but they can be darker or even white, such as Taraxacum albidum.
